Title: Relates to requiring certain child passengers in a taxi or livery to be restrained by a child restraint system
Summary: Requires that no person under four years of age shall be a passenger in a taxi or livery unless such person is restrained by a child restraint system; requires that no person four years of age or older but under age eight shall be a passenger in a taxi or livery unless such person is restrained in an appropriate child restraint system; establishes violations of such provisions shall be punished by a civil fine of up to fifty dollars.

ActClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to requiring certain child passengers in a taxi or livery to be restrained by a child restraint system
